contents.contents: Go down the “Rue Jean-Desmarets and turn left into the “Rue de la Pie”. You should be able to see the Caesar Tower, your next stop.
In spite of its name, this tower is not Roman. The name was given during the Renaissance. This impressive tower has been used in different ways (as a watch tower, as a prison and as a church tower).

question.contents: What was the aim of this building?
choices: To assert the power of the lord
As a residence of Thibaud IV of Champagne

explanations.contents: Originally, it was used as a donjon but actually it was meant to assert the power of the lord.
